title: In Lebanon, a million people displaced in a country in chaos
summary: The scale and intensity of the Israeli offensive launched on Lebanon on September 23 forced many residents to seek refuge, catching humanitarian organizations unawares.

title: Biden says Israel has a 'right to respond' to Iran, but 'in proportion'
summary: Joe Biden set a clear red line for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after the Islamic republic fired off roughly 200 ballistic missiles in Tuesday night's attack on Israel.

title: Motion to impeach Macron rejected by Parliament committee
summary: The motion had little support outside of the radical left party La France Insoumise.

title: Ukraine's armed forces continue to retreat in the face of Russian attacks
summary: With fewer human and material resources, Ukraine is struggling to hold out, as evidenced by the imminent fall of the town of Vuhledar in the Donetsk region.

title: Biden, Harris tour areas hit by Hurricane Helene: 'We have towns that have disappeared'
summary: Harris visited Georgia, while Biden surveyed Asheville, North Carolina by helicopter, with the staggering destruction including collapsed bridges, debris-filled lakes, demolished buildings and washed-away roads.

title: French brand Coperni's runway show is a dream-come-true delight at Disneyland Paris for Fashion Week
summary: After two years of negotiations with Disney, the husband-and-wife-founded fashion house held its Spring/Summer 2025 show in front of Sleeping Beauty's illuminated castle.

title: Lee Miller, a photojournalist amid the bombs in Saint-Malo
summary: An exhibition presents around 50 images by the surrealist artist-turned-war-correspondent for 'Vogue,' who photographed the city's liberation in August 1944.

title: Dominican Republic announces plan to deport 10,000 undocumented Haitians per week
summary: The government made its decision in light of the international community's 'slowness' in restoring stability in Haiti, large parts of which have been overrun by gangs.

title: French luxury goods giant LVMH announces Formula One sponsorship
summary: Bernard Arnault, one of the world's richest men and CEO of the luxury group, known for brands like Louis Vuitton and Moet Hennessy, described the 10-year sponsorship deal as a 'great and unique partnership.'

title: What does the newly-opened Nintendo Museum in Kyoto look like?
summary: On Wednesday, the famous console and video game company opens the first venue of its kind to honor the brand. With its interactive exhibits and minimalist writings, the building is designed to appeal to visitors' nostalgia.

title: Purchase of Pink Floyd's catalogue: 'Sony is crazy about old rockers'
summary: The record company acquired the British band's music catalogue for $400 million, after former frontman Roger Waters made a number of controversial political appearances, notes economic journalist Isabelle Chaperon in her column.

title: Vice presidential debate: 'Candidates are trying to both mobilize their base and appeal to undecided voters'
summary: Ludivine Gilli, director of the North America Observatory at the Fondation Jean Jaurès, answered readers' questions after the debate between the two running mates, an important stage in the run-up to the November 5 vote.

title: Paul Watson case: Greenland further extends anti-whaling activist's detention
summary: A Greenland court issued the third extension of the environmental activist's detention period, pending a legal review of an extradition request by Japan, which has long had an arrest warrant open for Watson.

title: Fear of regional war heightens after Iran missile attack on Israel
summary: Tehran fired almost 200 ballistic missiles toward Israel on Tuesday evening, on the same day the Israeli army led incursions into Lebanon. Israel's air defense, supported by the US and France, intercepted most of the missiles.

title: Macron and Scholz differ on tariffs on Chinese electronic vehicles
summary: Amid a context of EU Commission plans for import duties on Chinese electric cars, France's Emmanuel Macron voiced support for the tariffs, whereas Germany's Olaf Scholz called for 'negotiations' with China.

title: Vance-Walz debate: Watch the key moments
summary: With the US presidential election nearly a month away, the Republican and Democratic vice-presidential candidates faced off in a televised debate.

title: French government promises €40 billion in spending cuts in 2025
summary: Half of these cuts would come from the state budget, the rest from social security and local authorities. Pensions would not be adjusted until July 2025. At the same time, €20 billion of taxes would be raised.

title: French finance minister says new tax hikes to target the wealthy and be 'temporary'
summary: Antoine Armand said on French radio on Wednesday that low and middle earners would be spared from raised taxes, describing it as an 'exceptional and temporary effort' for 'those with extremely high incomes.'

title: Georges Abdallah, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict's longest-held prisoner, wants out
summary: The Lebanese pro-Palestinian Marxist activist has been detained in France for almost 40 years for complicity in the assassination of two diplomats, one American and one Israeli, in Paris in 1982. Eleven years after his last attempt, he has applied for parole.

title: 'Iran finds itself trapped in a network of regional alliances ... to ensure the security of its regime'
summary: Tehran and Jerusalem are entering a downward spiral of violence with no end in sight, explains 'Le Monde' editorial writer Alain Frachon in his column.

title: Trump 'resorted to crimes' to overturn 2020 election, special counsel alleges in unsealed court doc
summary: The 165-page motion filed by Special Counsel Jack Smith argues for the historic case against Trump to move forward. Trump, on his Truth Social page, says 'Democrats are Weaponizing the Justice Department against me because they know I am WINNING.'

title: Deadly Israeli strike on central Beirut kills at least six
summary: Residents in multiple parts of southern Beirut were told by the Israeli military to leave the area in the early hours of Thursday morning, in an order published on social media.

title: OpenAI, creator of ChatGPT, valued at $157 billion
summary: The announcement comes on the heels of a massive $6.6 billion in new funding and the resignation of several company executives in recent months

title: Doctor linked to death of 'Friends' star Matthew Perry pleads guilty
summary: Mark Chavez pleaded guilty on Wednesday to conspiring to distribute the drug ketamine to the actor Matthew Perry, who died of a ketamine overdose in October 2023.

title: French PM Barnier presents 'roadmap' for political continuity amid break with Macron's approach
summary: In his first speech to Parliament, the prime minister pledged to make 'dialogue and the culture of compromise a principle of government.'

title: Iran's strikes on Israel illustrate its military strengths and weaknesses
summary: Tehran was able to demonstrate the credibility of its missile arsenal, even if many of the projectiles were thwarted. But the attack also highlighted the limits of the response capability of an army with no air force, air defense or anti-ballistic missiles.

title: At the EU Parliament fake jobs trial, Marine Le Pen lays out a political defense
summary: The former president of the far-right Rassemblement National, accused of using European Union loans to pay her employees, made her first statement in court on Wednesday evening.

title: Why Jean-Marie Le Pen is excused from French far right's fake jobs trial
summary: Although he was charged with 'misappropriation of public funds,' the founder of the far-right Front National (FN) party is absent from the trial for health reasons. At 96, he appears to be suffering from cognitive impairment.

title: In southern Lebanon, Israel and Hezbollah clash on the ground
summary: On Wednesday, the Israeli army announced the death of eight of its men in fighting with the Shiite movement. Six people were killed when Israel bombed one of its relief centers in the heart of Beirut.

title: The slow atrophy of unions in the US, despite Biden
summary: Despite his constant – and unprecedented – support for blue-collar workers, Joe Biden has not succeeded in reviving a union dynamic in his country. A losing bet that proves a president can't do everything, explains Le Monde's Jean-Michel Bezat in his column.

title: Georgia signs into law measures curbing LGBTQ+ rights
summary: Passed by the speaker of Georgia's parliament on Thursday, the controversial 'family values' bill puts homosexual relations on a par with 'incest.' It also bans gender transition, adoption by gay and transgender people, and nullifies same-sex marriages performed abroad.
